page.title: 09Twyning's Past
page.content: The{shop}used to be two cottages but these were burnt down and the shop was built over them. Opposite the shop is the{school,}built in{1907.}Until approximately{1930}it had no play-area so the children used the{green}for their playground, which was quite safe because only one or two cars would use the road each day. The road went down to the{river where the{ferry}was, which went across the river to{Bredon.}The ferry was fairly big as it could hold a car. The cost of the ferry in old money was{5d for a car,{2d}for you and your bicycle and{1d}for just yourself. Where{Orchard Drive}is there used to be an orchard belonging to{Warner's {bus service,}from which nineteen tons of damsons were picked each year.
